message: Do we have military technology geeks in here?
story: Ahmed Al-Amir shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: U.S. Troops Can Now Call in Tomahawk Cruise Missiles for Close Air Support
caption: medium.com
description: And that’s not the old munition’s only new trick

data.message: Tomahawk is designed as a strategic weapon, e.g. long range attack on large fixed targets. This article mentions that it can be used as a tactical weapon, e.g. hit a moving convoy. This means that Tomahawk needs to get updated info on target location, possibly from different sources: a marksman, a tracking device, a drone, or a satellite.
Yes, this update is directed towards close air support. The US is considering wide updates to its CAS systems, even including replacing the iconic A-10 Warthog.
If you're talking about the plans to replace A-10 with F35, then I don't think it will happen. F35 has a lot of problems AFAIK.

I remember reading on reddit a while ago that there are two parallel lines: one for replacing the Warthog with a better plane, and another for getting the F-35 into the field. Those two lines tackle completely different domains and should not intersect, but money talks after all and this might end up actually happening.
